lead_paragraph: Facebook posts suggest evidence of large-scale efforts to buy and sell weapons as large as guided missiles in the Middle East and North Africa.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Turkey, and Shuaib Almosawa from Yemen.

headline.main: Facebook Groups Act as Weapons Bazaars for Militias

snippet: Facebook posts suggest evidence of large-scale efforts to buy and sell weapons as large as guided missiles in the Middle East and North Africa.
abstract: Facebook shuts down six online bazaars where users can purchase range of weapons after The New York Times provides company with examples of seven suspicious groups; analysis of Facebook posts from these groups, which have been appearing in Middle East countries where Islamic State has its strongest presence, point to large-scale efforts to sell military weapons to terrorists and militants.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
